data.contentText:
These babies are not unwell 
RR is usually between 60-80 breaths per minute & don't need oxygen
This should resolve in 6 hours.
TTN is more likely following elective C-section due to wet lungs

metadata.text1:
- If sats < 90% in air put on oxygen. Diagnosis is unlikely TTN! 
- Position airway in neutral and suction if necessary
metadata.text2: Babies with TTN are likely to need cup/NGT until RR < 60
metadata.text3: If the Tachypnoea continues longer than 6 hours or any other signs/symptoms develop e.g. fever then it is unlikely TTN and might be sepsis so start antibiotics.

data.title: MANAGEMENT
